title: Region defined by radical function, vert. lines

content.question:
Let R be the region bounded by the x–axis, the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3910@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the line x = 4.

(a) Find the area of the region R.

frqParts.text:
Let R be the region bounded by the x–axis, the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3910@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the line x = 4.

(a) Find the area of the region R.
(b) Find the value of h such that the vertical line x = h divides the region R into two regions of equal area.
(c) Find the volume of the solid generated when R is revolved about the x–axis.
(d) The vertical line x = k divides the region R into two regions such that when these two regions are revolved about the x–axis, they generate solids with equal volumes. Find the value of k.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
